content.raw:
This is not ideal. Explicitly calling a destructor can lead to undefined behavior (such as double free). The scene pointer in this case is a boost shared pointer, so the destructor should get called automatically when all instances are released (see the line `this->scenes.clear()` below). 

I also noticed that `Scene::Clear` destroys the heightmap. This line is probably not needed.
content.html:
This is not ideal. Explicitly calling a destructor can lead to undefined behavior (such as double free). The scene pointer in this case is a boost shared pointer, so the destructor should get called automatically when all instances are released (see the line this->scenes.clear() below).

I also noticed that Scene::Clear destroys the heightmap. This line is probably not needed.
